entities.label: MSRCSecurityUpdate
entities.title: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability
entities.summary: This post discusses a vulnerability in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) that could lead to information disclosure. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform an unprivileged write to enclave memory from a host application, potentially leaking memory contents of the enclave. The impact of this vulnerability is moderate, and the exploitability is less likely.

faqs.question: What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?
faqs.answer: The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is Enclave memory read - unprivileged write to enclave memory from a host application, which can leak memory contents of the enclave.

faqs.question: According to the CVSS metric, successful exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to some loss of integrity (I:L)? What does that mean for this vulnerability?
faqs.answer: The attacker who successfully exploits the vulnerability could lead to file overwrite, which has minimal impact.

faqs.question: What is the version information for this release?
faqs.answer: Microsoft Edge Version: 118.0.2088.46, Based on Chromium Version: 118.0.5993.70/.71, Date Released: 10/13/2023

entities.label: Symptom
entities.description: An attacker can perform an unprivileged write to enclave memory from a host application, potentially leaking memory contents of the enclave.

entities.label: Cause
entities.description: The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) that allows unprivileged write to enclave memory from a host application.
